alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 12:01PM CST until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Perryville For the Tennessee River...including Savannah, Perryville, Johnsonville...Minor to moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Perryville. * WHEN...From Friday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 367.0 feet, In Perry County, Deer Creek Road to Riverfront Subdivision is flooded. In Decatur County in Cherokee Heights, water begins to flood the intersection of Divider Drive and Bill Perry Drive at the north end of Woodlawn Shores. Water also begins to flood the access road to Yarbro Landing. Water reaches the intersection of Brodies Landing Road and Sears Lane, and is flooding the boat ramp area of the Perryville Landing access area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 362.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 367.1 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 365.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
